items.title: San Franciscans urged to get flu vaccines ahead of holiday season
items.summary: With influenza season beginning in November, San Franciscans should add a flu vaccine on top of their COVID-19 vaccine or booster, if eligible, for a safer and healthier holiday season.

items.title: SF reaches milestone as 70% of the City's Black, African-American population has received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose
items.summary: The vaccination rate among Black, African-American individuals in SF is a testament to strong community partnerships and a drive toward equity.

items.title: Bay Area health officers issue criteria for lifting COVID-19 indoor masking requirements
items.summary: As COVID-19 case rates and hospitalizations decline, health officers for the nine Bay Area jurisdictions that require face coverings in most indoor public spaces today reached consensus on criteria to lift those health orders.

items.title: SF to open COVID-19 testing site for SFUSD students and staff
items.summary: SF is partnering with SFUSD to open a COVID-19 testing site at Crocker Amazon sports complex in the Excelsior District with 150 tests per day for SFUSD students and staff starting October 5.

items.title: SF prepares vaccination plans for children under age 12 and booster doses
items.summary: A joint statement from the San Francisco Department of Public Health, Dignity Health, Sutter Health, UCSF, Chinese Hospital, and Kaiser Permanente.
